page.title: 13LOCAL HISTORY Cotleigh/Stoc:
page.content: There are two iron age camps in the area, Stockland Great and Little camps.Several paleolithic hand axes and a large number of Mesolithic and Neolithic flints have been found in the area and are being removed to Exeter Museum.There are two mills,probably the ones mentioned in Domesday 1086,and a Georgian house which was a lunatic asylum in the C19th.A number of houses are listed buildings.On either side of the Umborne brook is a stone hidden in the hedge which marked the area of road surface to be repaired by the county as distinct from the parish.Dick Turpin is reputed to have stayed a night at the"Three Mariners" inn,which is now a private house.
